main event: A civilian observer sighted a reddish-yellow cigar-shaped object emitting a spray of smoke or vapor over White Lake, South Dakota on September 9, 1952.
interesting points: The object was very bright and observed through binoculars for over 30 minutes., The observer estimated the object to be approximately 30-45 feet in diameter and moving at about 100 mph., A similar object was sighted in the area around the same time for about the same duration., The observer requested confidentiality and was only in town for a personal investigation., No physical evidence of the object was available and no interception actions were taken.
sighted object: reddish-yellow cigar-shaped object with smoke or vapor
witness description: Civilian observer who had been in the town for 5 days conducting a personal investigation.
